properties.name: 711 3rd St SE, first Valley City house
properties.description: Posted by Jax2006711 3rd St SE, Valley City, NDThis is where we lived from 1982 to about 1989 when we moved to the other house at 120 14th Street (so that Mom could move back in with us - the new house was one story, the old house was 2 story). This house had a huge side yard because it was built on 2 lots. It also had a big back yard which led down to the river (a steep slope with an old wooden set of stairs). We had no dock though so we couldn\'t really fish down there, although we did try to launch our rubber boat from the bottom of the steps sometimes. The backyard was also full of holes dug by previous owner\'s dog. I used one of these holes to make a Yoda house by thatching it across the top with sticks, twigs and grass. I kept my yoda figure in there quite a lot although it was a pain if it rained, or my dad wanted to mow the lawn.

properties.name: Bismarck and Mandan, ND (1976ish-1982)
properties.description: Posted by Jax2006 204 8th Avenue NW, Mandan, NDWe moved here from Milwaukee and my sisters were born in Mandan in 1979. I went to Roosevelt Elementary School (teachers Mrs. Jacobson and Mrs. Matson) and then moved away right before 3rd grade. I started piano lessons here with Miss Mushik. Looking on the map here, there was a little restaurant about a block away (I think on Main) where I liked to go get ice cream. I think in that big empty area north of 2nd St. NW and south of 3rd ST NW was my school. The picture is a bridge across the Missouri River which is actually in Bismarck, where we lived briefly in an apt before moving to Mandan.

properties.name: Brian Auto Repair
properties.description: Posted by Jax2006Brian Auto Repair was the beloved hospital for my 86 Honda Civic when I was living nearby in Santa Clara. Jae Ho Chang is the owner (at least I think he is the owner, he was the main person there when I went) and was very descriptive of exactly what work he was going to perform and why, and showed me all the parts that he had taken out and explained what had been wrong with them, why they were replaced. His specially appears to be Asian cars, as he did flatly refuse to help me with my Beetle when I bought it, and sadly we parted. But he is awesome and highly recommended 1170 WILLOW AVE STE 4, SUNNYVALE, CA 94086 (408) 246-5815

properties.name: Buca di Beppo
properties.description: Posted by Jax2006643 Emerson Street Palo Alto CALarge Italian family-style restaurant, large portions, cool decor of various crazy pictures, great bathroom decorations. Usha threw a birthday party here for me a few years ago, it was a great surprise.

properties.name: Cascal
properties.description: Posted by Jax2006400 Castro Street Mountain View CAThis is a little pricey but has lots of fun little tapas and drinks. We went here one afternoon just for a little break in shopping.

properties.name: Charlie's Cafe, Freeport, MN
properties.description: Posted by Jax2006   115 E Main St, Freeport, MN This is one of the restaurants that was the model for Garrison Keillor\'s Chatterbox Cafe in Lake Wobegon. We often stop by here if we\'re driving back and forth between Valley City and Minneapolis. Tel: (320) 836-2105

properties.name: Cure Nail Spa
properties.description: Posted by Jax20061240 Powell Street Suite 1-B Emeryville, CAThis is a really fun little nail spa near my office, where we went in early March (myself and 2 other co-workers) to use up some gift certificates. It is really relaxing and on Thursday nights they serve free Cosmos (or nice lemon water).

properties.name: Doyle Street Cafe
properties.description: Posted by Jax2006    5515 Doyle St, Emeryville CANext door to my workplace, this is the best place for a quick lunch without having to spend any time in transit. I like the people who work there and the friendly atmosphere. Two brothers run the place and they are very friendly. The Reuben is good, the turkey sandwich is my default quick meal, and BBQ Quesadillas, which are a special, are also very good. Too bad I never feel like I can go there and completely relax.

properties.name: Foster City (brief sojourn as houseguest, 1995)
properties.description: Posted by Jax2006792 Widgeon, Foster City, CAMy friend\'s parents offered to let me stay with them when my foot was broken and my apt lease had run out before the dorms at Stanford opened back up.

properties.name: Foster City Recreation Center
properties.description: Posted by Jax2006 , , CAWedding and Reception Location Lagoon Room, Foster City Recreation Center 650 Shell Blvd, Foster City, CA

properties.name: Foster's Bighorn Restaurant
properties.description: Posted by Jax2006  143 Main Street, Rio Vista, CAThis was where we went for lunch on the day of the Cattarins\' wedding, it was a treat from Mr. Wagner. Throughout the meal we were watched by the many eyes of the trophies looking down from the wall, but the food was really yummy and it was fun to hang out with the groomsmen and fathers! This is a very wacky place - a big game hunter owned the place and has turned it into one of the largest collections of trophies in the world. "The Bighorn now has one of the world\'s most remarkable collections of wild game trophies, including the heads of more than 300 wild animals, birds and fish from every part of the globe. One of the few mounted heads of a full-grown African elephant in existence is in the collection. "

properties.name: Fright Elevator in Vallco Mall
properties.description: Posted by Jax2006 10150 N Wolfe Rd, Cupertino, 95014 At Vallco Mall in San Jose I was buying an outfit for a business meeting last week. I was really tired and had been on a long odyssey through the mall looking for the restroom. The mall is under construction so the hallway to the bathroom was long and narrow and dark, very scary. On the left side of the corridor was this "Fright Elevator" sign. The men\'s bathroom was at the end of the hallway and then one had to turn left and walk even further to get to the women\'s. There were a bunch of little kids walking around in here, I waited until no one was looking to take the picture.

properties.name: Funny Restroom Sign in Virginia
properties.description: Posted by Jax20061500 King Street, Alexandria, Virginia 22314A friend sent me this picture, it\'s in the bathroom of one of his company\'s clients.

properties.name: Grand Island Mansion and Spa
properties.description: Posted by Jax2006 13415 Grand Island Road Walnut Grove, California 95690-9765The site for the Cattarin Wedding, up in the Delta, and where we stayed in the palatial rooms upstairs after the wedding. Very beautiful place.

properties.name: Hilton Garden Inn
properties.description: Posted by Jax2006 2000 Bridgepointe Circle •San Mateo, CA 94404Hilton Garden Inn in San Mateo 2000 Bridgepointe Circle, San Mateo, CA 94404 This is where the wedding block of rooms is reserved.

properties.name: Jing Jing's
properties.description: Posted by Jax2006443 Emerson Street, Palo Alto, CAAnother great place to eat- spicy Chinese food. We saw Jerry Rice here once getting take-out.

properties.name: Lodi Errands
properties.description: Posted by Jax2006Lodi, CADave and Solveig drove to Lodi on the day of the wedding to pick up a few items.

properties.name: Main Street Coffee Roasting CO
properties.description: Posted by Jax2006 150 Elm Street, Redwood City, CA, 94063Main Street Coffee Roasting CO 650-368-3430

properties.name: Marrakesh Moroccan Restaurant
properties.description: Posted by Jax2006   419 O\'Farrell Street, San FranciscoA retreat from the streets of San Francisco and the stress of all of our jobs, Marrakesh Moroccan Restaurant was a very relaxing place for our group to have lunch! Just relaxing on the couches, washing our hands in a basin with warm water flowing, eating leisurely in a couple different salad and main courses, and having the chance to talk.

properties.name: Milwaukee, WI
properties.description: Posted by Jax2006Milwaukee, WII lived here as a young toddler. The legend is that when I was learning to walk, I said, "Me walk ee!"

properties.name: Monroe, WI
properties.description: Posted by Jax2006Monroe, WII was born here in 1974, but only lived there for about a year. "Nestled amongst green rolling hills and patchwork of dairy farms is Monroe, Wisconsin, a Rockwellian portrait of small town America where a cup of coffee is still 50c and where the community thrives through the hard work of its residents. Midway between Lake Michigan and the Mississippi River in southern Green County, Monroe is easily a few hours drive or less from many midwestern urban centers, including Chicago, Milwaukee, Dubuque, and St. Paul- Minneapolis."

properties.name: Mt View Condo
properties.description: Posted by Jax2006 I was living here when 9/11 happened, my roommate called me into the living room to watch it on TV (back when we had a TV). I lived here from 1999-2002 and then again from 2004-2006.

properties.name: Palo Alto (summer 1995)
properties.description: Posted by Jax20063553 Alma Street, Palo Alto, CAThis is where I lived, sharing a room with Hope, in the summer between junior and senior years. Also the place where I was recovering from my bus accident, living mostly downstairs on the couch since the bedrooms were upstairs.

properties.name: Paradise, CA
properties.description: Posted by Jax2006Paradise, CAThis is where I lived during the summer of 1993 (right after finishing my freshman year of college). I was an intern at the Paradise Post, working mostly on feature stories (the education beat, some fires, some interviews with people, and obits!) I rented a room from Lorena who was one of the editors at the paper. She rocked, I was worried about finding a place and was only going to stay with her until I found another place, but she liked me... Paradise is larger than Valley City in population but felt like the same type of small town feeling. (car doors left unlocked, etc). Gary Burghoff of MASH lives up in the hills, or at least used to...

properties.name: Philo's Art Car
properties.description: Posted by Jax2006 5515 Doyle St, Emeryville, CAThis is the Art Car of Philo, one of the exec producers at our company and co-runner of the annual Art Car Festival in the Bay Area. I added this place because I noticed several other art car tags...

properties.name: Pizza Corner
properties.description: Posted by Jax2006Pizza Corner was a fixture of my childhood growing up in Valley City, North Dakota. It\'s very thin pizza, made fresh in the Pizza Corner restaurant (which expanded into a new storefront) and they also have a factory which ships out frozen pizza all over the upper Midwest. It was a tradition to go have Pizza Corner pizza at the restaurant with the fountain pop (making mixtures of it from self-serve fountain) and then have the free ice cream in the Dixie cups afterward. Or we just called to order it and get it delivered. We used to live close enough to the restaurant to walk down there...

properties.name: Regal Bagel
properties.description: Posted by Jax2006Great bagels and owned by a friendly couple. On the way to work so easier to go to than Posh Bagel which is in downtown Mt View

properties.name: Ryde Hotel
properties.description: Posted by Jax2006 14340 Highway 160 Walnut Grove, CA 95690This is where we stayed on Friday night and the hub of activity for the Cattarin-Wagner wedding, From the website: Inside the Lobby warm greetings and authentic smiles welcome guests. (The lady at the front desk was very nice and very good at giving directions although the bridge she kept referring to as "The Green Bridge" did not look very green to us). The property boasts an executive nine-hole golf course winding through a magnificent pear orchard, park-like grounds with a 20,000 gallon swimming pool and a private boat dock. Located in the heart of the Delta, there is immediate access to hundreds of miles of warm, calm waterways offering world class fishing, power and sail boating, water skiing and sightseeing. (We didn\'t do any boating). In addition, the Ryde frequently hosts special events and there is an awesome Champagne Brunch Buffet every Sunday in the Main Dining Room. (We saw people eating this brunch on Sunday, it smelled good but we didn\'t stay for it). Hotel guests also have the use of the salon off the lobby where continental breakfast is served on weekends. (We all spent a lot of fun time in this "salon" - eating breakfast, drinking coffee, and chatting).

properties.name: Sacramento Bridesmaids' Hair Appts
properties.description: Posted by Jax2006SacramentoAndrea and her bridesmaids had hair appts beginning at 9 am on the day of the wedding.

properties.name: San Francisco International Airport
properties.description: Posted by Jax2006

properties.name: Sarah A Tull, CPA, Accounting, tax services and more
properties.description: Posted by Jax2006711 Colorado Ave Palo Alto, CA 94303Recommended by Rich Chambers for my tax problems...

properties.name: Shabuway
properties.description: Posted by Jax2006180 Castro St. Mountain View, CA 94041This place is very healthy and really a fun participative eating experience as you are constantly looking at your little pot of water and deciding what to cook next? Is it time yet for the tofu? What about a little more noodles? Which dipping sauce haven\'t I sampled enough of yet? Very tasty and you can also get an Unagi bowl and other yummy stuff. It\'s not all beef, you can have it with just tofu as well. Info from their site: SHABU SHABU is a traditional Japanese Cuisine. It is beef fondue. "SHABU SHABU" means "swish-swish", referring to the swishing action when you cook a very thin slice of beef in the hot water.

properties.name: Spices
properties.description: Posted by Jax2006291 6TH Ave, san francisco, caSpicy Szechuan food in San Francisco - Ardry and Derek took us there for my birthday weekend.

properties.name: Stanford University (1992-1996)
properties.description: Posted by Jax2006Stanford UniversityThis is where I went to college, majored in English with Creative Writing Emphasis, and met various people that I am still friends with today. I lived specifically in Cardenal (Florence Moore), Toyon (two years) and Slavianskii Dom.

properties.name: Sunset and Plane Path, Monroe and Lawrence, Santa Clara
properties.description: Posted by Jax2006Lawrence Expressway, Santa Clara, CAThis is a picture taken while at the stop light of Monroe/Reed and Lawrence, about to turn right onto Lawrence. There was a nice sunset and a plane going overhead, this is with Treo camera so might not be that great of a picture. Not weird, but this map is branching out into just Random things seen in public.

properties.name: The Point Restaurant
properties.description: Posted by Jax2006 120 Marina Drive Rio Vista, CA 94571This is the restaurant in Rio Vista in the Delta where we had Jim and Andrea\'s wedding rehearsal dinner. It was very good! I had shrimp scampi!

properties.name: The Spyhouse
properties.description: Posted by Jax20062451 Nicollet Ave. S., Minneapolis, MNOne of my favorite places to hang out when visiting my sisters in Minneapolis, very cozy and great coffee and tea, and in the summer they open the windows out to the street and it is nice and breezy. I\'m usually there in winter where it is a welcome refuge from the cold and a handy place to wait for a bus. This is right near the Minneapolis Institute of Arts so there is a lot of good people-watching with art students and such. The picture was taken with my goofy dad, of our artfully displayed matching cell phones, GPS devices, and coffee cups. Go team!

properties.name: Valley City, ND (Home of Dad)
properties.description: Posted by Jax2006Valley City, ND 58072This is a small town in North Dakota, about 7,000 people. I lived here from 1982 (3rd grade) to 1992 (graduation from high school). My dad still lives here now. Exact address not shown because my dad still lives there...

properties.name: Vaso Rojo, Santa Clara (1997 to 1998)
properties.description: Posted by Jax20062526 Amethyst Drive, Santa Clara, CAThis is where Vanessa, myself, Rosie, and Hope (VaSoRoHo!) lived in Santa Clara. The house had a nice redwood deck and a hot tub (the hot tub was kind of old but we used it every so often). My room opened out onto the deck. I went to visit it today, it looks much nicer than when we lived there. The picket fence is new.

properties.name: Zarubin Family Picnic
properties.description: Posted by Jax2006 San Mateo, CADave and I went to a family picnic here right after leaving the wedding area on Sunday afternoon, and saw many aunts, uncles, cousins, plus Dave\'s brother Mark and his kids whom we had not seen since Christmas and are now even taller than they were then.
